Dear Sheffield City Council,
Dear Highways Department
I am requesting information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000 regarding carriageway repairs in the council area. I would like to request the following data:
Question 1
Do you use internal or external contractors to facilitate the following pothole repairs, patching works, pre patching and small scale resurfacing projects
Question 2
What machinery do you use for pothole repairs, patching works, pre patching and small scale resurfacing works
Question 3
How much do you spend per pothole repair on average via traditional methods and machinery repairs
Question 4
How much does it cost you to repair each identified pothole on average?
Question 5
Are you in contact with a company for pothole/patching/pre-pathing repairs? if so who is this contractor with
Question 6
How many years does this contract have left to run for pothole/patching works
Question 7
What machinery have you reviewed/received a demo on to speed up carriageway repairs
Question 8
How do you fund pothole & patching repairs, Capital or revenue, what is the split?
Question 9
Do you use your own internal teams for Highways repairs? In relation to potholes/ patching and pre patching?
Question 10
What frameworks do you call upon for additional machinery or operatives, in relation to Highway repairs?
Yours faithfully,
Steven Thomas

Dear Steven Thomas,
Thank you for your request for information relating to carriageway repairs
which we received on 07/04/2025.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 08/05/2025. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Please note that from 1^st January 2025, as part of our commitment to
improving services, the council will accept EIR requests via the online
form which can be found here:
[1]Freedom of Information and Environmental Information requests |
Sheffield City Council
Please bookmark this link for future requests.
The online form is linked directly to our systems in the FOI service as
part of our continued improvement to streamline processes.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Steven Thomas
Thank you for your request for information relating to carriageway repairs
which we received on 07/04/2025.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Question 1
Do you use internal or external contractors to facilitate the following
pothole repairs, patching works, pre patching and small scale resurfacing
projects
Sheffield City Council has a Private Finance Initiative contract with Amey
Hallam Highways Ltd for the delivery of a complete highway maintenance
service which includes all highway maintenance activities such as street
lighting, street cleaning, carriageway and footway resurfacing, signal
maintenance, etc.  Amey currently uses both its own internal teams and
external contractors.
Question 2
What machinery do you use for pothole repairs, patching works, pre
patching and small scale resurfacing works
Amey uses the following machinery:
Whacker plate
JCB
Roller
Stihl Saw
Breaker
Cat and Genny
Question 3
How much do you spend per pothole repair on average via traditional
methods and machinery repairs
Sheffield City Council has a Private Finance Initiative contract with Amey
Hallam Highways Ltd for the delivery of a complete highway maintenance
service which includes all highway maintenance activities such as street
lighting, street cleaning, carriageway and footway resurfacing, signal
maintenance, etc.  Payments made by the Council under the contract do not
relate to the provision of specific items of work.  Instead, a single
payment is made for each month of the 25-year term of the contract.  As a
result, we do not have a figure for the costs incurred by Amey for
individual operations such as pothole repair.
Question 4
How much does it cost you to repair each identified pothole on average?
See answer to Question 3.
Question 5
Are you in contact with a company for pothole/patching/pre-pathing
repairs? if so, who is this contractor with
Amey is currently responsible for all highway maintenance activities.
Subcontractors are used to support with specialist maintenance activities
where required. We are withholding the name of the sub-contractor.
Regulation 12(5)(e) of the Environmental Information Regulations 2004
(EIR) provides an exception for the confidentiality of commercial
information where such confidentiality is provided by law to protect a
legitimate economic interest.
(1) The information is commercial because Amey Hallam Highways Ltd is
trading company operating for profit.
(2) The information is subject to confidentiality provided by law. There
is a duty of confidence that the council owes its contractors.
(3) The legitimate economic interests of Amey are maintaining their
competitiveness in an open market. We want to avoid publishing information
which would likely prejudice their ability to compete for other contracts.
(4) Confidentiality would be adversely affected by disclosure because it
is subject to confidentiality provided by law and that confidentiality was
provided to protect a legitimate economic interest.
Regulation 12(5)(e) is subject to the public interest test set out at
regulation 12(1)(b). Therefore, the Council must consider whether, in all
the circumstances of the case, the public interest in maintaining the
exception outweighs the public interest in disclosing the withheld
information.
Furthermore, regulation 12(2) of the EIR requires a public authority to
apply a presumption in favour of disclosure when relying on any of the
regulation 12 exceptions.
The public interest in disclosure is transparency and accountability.
The public interest withholding the information is the harm to the
commercial interests of Amey Hallam Highways Ltd, which will be
disadvantaged compared to its competitors.
The public interest in maintaining the exception outweighs the public
interest in disclosure. This is because, the withheld information retains
a commercial sensitivity, and it would not be in the public interest for
information to be disclosed which would prejudice the Council’s efforts to
maintain proper relationships with its contractors.
In reaching this decision we have relied upon the guidance from the
Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO). The ICO is the independent
regulator of public authorities application of information rights law. The
guidance is
here: [1]
https://ico.org.uk/for-organisations/com...
Question 6
How many years does this contract have left to run for pothole/patching
works
The PFI Highway Maintenance Contract runs until 2037.
Question 7
What machinery have you reviewed/received a demo on to speed up
carriageway repairs
Amey has reviewed or received demonstrations of the following:
Thermo-Active road repair treatment
Road Mender Asphalt
Retread road surface treatment
Ralumac road surface treatment
Question 8
How do you fund pothole & patching repairs, Capital or revenue, what is
the split?
Sheffield City Council has a Private Finance Initiative contract with Amey
Hallam Highways Ltd for the delivery of a complete highway maintenance
service which includes all highway maintenance activities such as street
lighting, street cleaning, carriageway and footway resurfacing, signal
maintenance, etc.  Payments made by the Council under the contract do not
relate to the provision of specific items of work.  Instead, a single
payment is made for each month of the 25-year term of the contract.
Question 9
Do you use your own internal teams for Highways repairs? In relation to
potholes/ patching and pre patching?
Amey is currently responsible for all highway maintenance activities.
Subcontractors are used to support with specialist maintenance activities
where required.  Amey remains responsible for any highway sites.
Question 10
What frameworks do you call upon for additional machinery or operatives,
in relation to Highway repairs?
Amey partnerships with supply chains to source additional operatives and
machinery as and when required.
To learn more about Amey’s governance, or to investigate becoming a supply
chain partner, visit: [2]
https://www.amey.co.uk/about-us/governance
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [3]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[4]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
